key_title: Key to the species of Philotheca

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Rutaceae

leads.lead_text: Leaves leathery, papery or small and fleshy, terete to c. flat, apex never pungent
Leaves rigid, acicular, 5–15 (–25) mm long, apex pungent
Inflorescences terminal; petals persistent; branchlets with small, dark, stipule-like excrescences at either side of leaf-bases; leaves 2–10 mm long, with a few large tubercles
Inflorescences axillary; petals deciduous; branchlets without small, dark excrescences at leaf-bases; leaves usually greater than 10 mm long, dotted with many smallish glands
Branchlet hairs in rows between leaf decurrencies; petals glabrous outside
Branchlets with scattered hairs; petals hairy outside (at least toward margins)
Leaf margins slightly recurved and slightly to moderately glandular crenate; flowers solitary (or if 2 or 3 flowers arising from one axil, then not borne on a common peduncle)
Leaf margins not recurved or crenate; flowers in axillary umbels (or if solitary, then pedicels borne on a short peduncle)
Leaves usually wider than 5 mm; flowers 5-merous; carpels united along their outer margin by a thin layer of pericarp; fruit not beaked
Leaves usually less than 4 mm wide; flowers 4-merous; carpels free for most of their length; fruit shortly beaked
Leaves oblong to broad-elliptic, usually greater than 15 mm long, dotted with many small glands
Leaves obcordate, usually less than 15 mm long, smooth above, with large prominent glands below
